lexUnit.name: sizable.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: of considerable size; rather large

sentence.text: Given the importance of money as a means of storing wealth , these balances can be sizeable .
Even the wives ' cars were sizable .
` To balance the sizeable front wings , the sweep of the rear wings was slightly marked on the flanks .
The ridge is quickly gained and on this peach of a day was absolutely magnificent , with the hills retaining sizeable patches of spring snow that sparkled in the hazy sunshine .

I knew that the area where we were standing was sizeable enough .
Indeed , in the Irish general election of 1987 , progressive democrats took 14 seats , and 11.8 per cent of the total vote , which is sizeable for a young political party .
